title: Delta Lake & Apache Iceberg Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your understanding of modern data lakehouse technologies

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Delta Lake?
options: To provide ACID transactions on data lakes
To visualize data in real-time dashboards
questions.explanation: Delta Lake provides ACID transactions, scalable metadata handling, and unifies streaming and batch data processing on top of existing data lakes.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key feature of Apache Iceberg?
options: Schema evolution with full backward compatibility
Automatic data partitioning based on usage patterns
Real-time data streaming with sub-second latency
questions.explanation: Apache Iceberg supports schema evolution, allowing tables to evolve while maintaining full backward and forward compatibility.

questions.question: What does ACID stand for in the context of Delta Lake?
questions.explanation: ACID (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability) ensures reliable database transactions, which Delta Lake brings to data lakes.

questions.question: Which file format does Delta Lake use for storing data?
questions.explanation: Delta Lake uses Parquet for data storage and maintains transaction logs in JSON format to track changes.

questions.question: What is 'time travel' in Delta Lake?
options: The ability to query data as it existed at previous points in time
Automatic data migration between time zones
questions.explanation: Time travel allows you to query historical versions of data using timestamps or version numbers.

questions.question: Which cloud storage systems does Apache Iceberg support?
options: S3, GCS, Azure Blob Storage, and HDFS
questions.explanation: Apache Iceberg supports multiple cloud storage systems including Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage, and HDFS.

questions.question: What is schema evolution in the context of data lakehouse technologies?
options: The ability to change table schemas without breaking existing queries
Migration from one database to another
questions.explanation: Schema evolution allows tables to change structure (add/remove columns) while maintaining compatibility with existing data and queries.

questions.question: Which query engine can work with Delta Lake tables?
options: Spark, Presto, Athena, Redshift Spectrum, and Snowflake
questions.explanation: Delta Lake is query-engine agnostic and works with multiple engines including Spark, Presto, Athena, and others.

questions.question: What is the main difference between Delta Lake and Apache Iceberg?
options: Delta Lake is open-source, Iceberg is proprietary
Delta Lake originated from Databricks, Iceberg from Netflix
Delta Lake uses JSON logs, Iceberg uses Avro metadata
They serve the same purpose with different implementations
questions.explanation: Both Delta Lake and Apache Iceberg solve similar problems but with different architectural approaches and ecosystems.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using a data lakehouse approach?
questions.explanation: While data lakehouses provide many benefits, automatic data cleansing is not inherently provided - it requires additional tooling.
